page.title: 04ST.HILARY
page.content: ST.HILARY LIES TO THE EAST OF GOLDSITHNEY AND SHARES A COMMON BOUNDARY. IT IS A SCATTERED COMMUNITY CENTERING AROUND ST. HILARY CHURCHTOWN AND THE CHURCH. THE WINDING ROAD THROUGH THE CHURCHTOWN FOLLOWS THE ROUTE OF THE ANCIENT "TINNERS PATHWAY." THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH ON THE SITE FOR 800 YRS. WITH EVIDENCE OF ROMAN AND CELTIC PRESENCE EARLIER.THE CHURCH WAS USED FOR THE FIRST B.B.C. OUTSIDE BROADCAST. {ST.HILARY PRIMARY SCHOOL}IS OVER 100 YEARS OLD AND CATERS FOR THE CHILDREN OF GOLDSITHNEY AND THE SURROUNDING AREA. APART FROM ONE HOTEL THERE ARE NO SHOPS OR PUBS ETC. IN THE PARISH OF ST.HILARY.
